player_mentions.context: Despite coordinator changes, Detroit remains a top NFC contender with Jared Goff, Amon-Ra St. Brown, and a strong offensive line, projecting for 9.9 wins and sitting firmly in the playoff mix.
Despite coordinator changes, Detroit remains a top NFC contender with Jared Goff, Amon-Ra St. Brown, and a strong offensive line, projecting for 9.9 wins and sitting firmly in the playoff mix.
New England jumps in the rankings from 30th due to second-year QB Drake Maye and the return of Mike Vrabel and Josh McDaniels to the sideline, accelerating an expected rebound.
New Orleans sinks to 32nd in the rankings after Derek Carr’s offseason retirement, initiating a long-delayed transition for the Saints.
Rookie Tyler Shough is competing for the starting QB job under new coach Kellen Moore as the Saints begin a long-delayed transition after Derek Carr's retirement.
Spencer Rattler is competing for the starting QB job under new coach Kellen Moore as the Saints begin a long-delayed transition after Derek Carr's retirement.
Aaron Rodgers is listed among several veteran quarterbacks who changed teams for 2025, moving to Pittsburgh from the NY Jets.
Justin Fields is listed among several veteran quarterbacks who changed teams for 2025, moving to the NY Jets from Pittsburgh.
Russell Wilson is listed among several veteran quarterbacks who changed teams for 2025, moving to the NY Giants from Pittsburgh.
Daniel Jones is listed among veteran quarterbacks who changed teams for 2025, moving to Indianapolis and is competing with Anthony Richardson for the Colts’ Week 1 job.
Sam Darnold is listed among several veteran quarterbacks who changed teams for 2025, moving to Seattle from Minnesota.
Geno Smith is listed among several veteran quarterbacks who changed teams for 2025, moving to Las Vegas from Seattle.
Joe Flacco is listed among veteran quarterbacks who changed teams for 2025, moving to Cleveland, where he is the likely Week 1 starter but could split time with rookies for a rebuilding team.
Anthony Richardson is competing with Daniel Jones for the Colts’ Week 1 starting quarterback job.
The Washington Commanders, with rookie QB Jayden Daniels, were a team not expected to turn things around quickly last year but surprisingly made the playoffs.
Denver was the biggest surprise in the AFC last year, exceeding low expectations for rookie quarterback Bo Nix.
Tennessee's starting 1st overall pick Cam Ward at quarterback profiles as a sleeper, playing for a team that underachieved last year but has quality skill players.
Minnesota returns with a new young quarterback, J.J. McCarthy, taking over.
Minnesota will turn to QB Sam Darnold but boasts a lot of offensive weapons led by WR Justin Jefferson and a top offensive coach in Kevin O’Connell.
Arizona will have Kyler Murray at the start of the season, and their offense was much better once he returned in the latter half of last year.
Arizona adds a top wide receiver, Marvin Harrison, Jr., to the mix, enhancing the offense with Kyler Murray's full-season return.
Chicago will try to make a leap in Caleb Williams’ second year after a disappointing rookie campaign.
Dallas will hope to have a healthy Dak Prescott back and win shootouts, despite concerns about their defense driving down their odds.
New England added Milton Williams, Carlton Davis, Harold Landry and Robert Spillane, forming the core of a dangerous defense.
New England added Milton Williams, Carlton Davis, Harold Landry and Robert Spillane, forming the core of a dangerous defense.
New England added Milton Williams, Carlton Davis, Harold Landry and Robert Spillane, forming the core of a dangerous defense.
New England added Milton Williams, Carlton Davis, Harold Landry and Robert Spillane, forming the core of a dangerous defense.
Add in Drake Maye — possibly the best quarterback Vrabel has ever coached — and the Patriots look primed for a big leap.
Ravens second-round pick Mike Green wins Defensive Rookie of the Year. Green is in a perfect situation to rack up sacks in a division filled with quarterbacks who take a lot of hits.
Green is in a perfect situation to rack up sacks in a division filled with quarterbacks who take a lot of hits, including Aaron Rodgers, Joe Burrow and Joe Flacco.
Green is in a perfect situation to rack up sacks in a division filled with quarterbacks who take a lot of hits, including Aaron Rodgers, Joe Burrow and Joe Flacco.
Green is in a perfect situation to rack up sacks in a division filled with quarterbacks who take a lot of hits, including Aaron Rodgers, Joe Burrow and Joe Flacco.

Daniel Jones wins more games than Trevor Lawrence. If Daniel Jones can win more games in Indianapolis than Lawrence does in Jacksonville, it would be a brutal indictment of the former No. 1 overall pick.

This feels like a make-or-break year for Trevor Lawrence, who is just 2-13 in his past 15 starts. If Daniel Jones can win more games in Indianapolis than Lawrence does in Jacksonville, it would be a brutal indictment of the former No. 1 overall pick.
RJ Harvey wins Offensive Rookie of the Year. Sean Payton has a long history of maximizing rookie running backs, and if Payton spent premium draft capital on Harvey, he plans to use him — a lot.
The Vikings’ gamble on J.J. McCarthy goes south. Minnesota is handing the keys to a quarterback with zero career starts, questionable receiver health and minimal chemistry.
Baker Mayfield leads the NFL in passing yards. Mayfield is coming off a career year and now adds rookie Emeka Egbuka to a receiving group that already includes Mike Evans and Chris Godwin.
Mayfield is coming off a career year and now adds rookie Emeka Egbuka to a receiving group that already includes Mike Evans and Chris Godwin.
Mayfield is coming off a career year and now adds rookie Emeka Egbuka to a receiving group that already includes Mike Evans and Chris Godwin.
Mayfield is coming off a career year and now adds rookie Emeka Egbuka to a receiving group that already includes Mike Evans and Chris Godwin.
Brock Purdy wins MVP. With a healthy roster and the league’s easiest schedule, Purdy checks both boxes and could finally get the respect he deserves.

Micah Parsons' trade request has shaken things up in Dallas, and the Cowboys have been without one of their most indispensable players all camp so far.
Jalen Hurts is leading a balanced, mature and dangerous offense, profiling the Eagles as strong contenders once again.
Perennial MVP candidate Lamar Jackson in his prime makes the Ravens a nightmare matchup for most teams.
Derrick Henry is still seemingly close to his peak, contributing to the Ravens being a nightmare matchup for most teams.
The Chiefs' offense has been on a two-year downturn, and there's uncertainty about how much longer Travis Kelce will play beyond this season.
If Josh Simmons wins the rookie left tackle job, his performance alongside Kingsley Suamataia will be crucial for protecting Patrick Mahomes' blind side.
Kingsley Suamataia only lasted a few games at left tackle before being moved to left guard this year, and his performance with Josh Simmons will protect Patrick Mahomes.
The performance of the new left tackle duo will determine if the Chiefs can make strides offensively by protecting Patrick Mahomes' blind side.
First-round CB Maxwell Hairston is currently sidelined with a knee sprain, which is among the pesky early camp injuries.
The Bills might survive some WR injuries if Keon Coleman can stay healthy and make a big jump in Year 2, but that's hardly a guarantee.
Second-year pro Cole Bishop could help improve the secondary for the Bills with a level-up season.
Maxwell Hairston's knee sprain could lead to Tre’Davious White taking a starting gig early on for the Bills.
The Bills are one of the best teams in football, led by reigning MVP Josh Allen, with winning the division as an obvious goal.
The retirement of Frank Ragnow is part of the unfortunate attrition from last season, signaling a potentially bumpier road for the Lions.
Levi Onwuzurike's season-ending ACL injury contributes to the unfortunate attrition carried over from last season for the Lions.
Thankfully, Aidan Hutchinson doesn’t appear to be dealing with previous ailments, and he’s apparently been dominating camp practices for the Lions.
First-round DT Tyleik Williams has impressed in the absence of Levi Onwuzurike and Frank Ragnow, which is a positive sign for the Lions.
Second-round IOL Tate Ratledge has impressed in the absence of Levi Onwuzurike and Frank Ragnow, which is a positive sign for the Lions.
Third-round WR Isaac TeSlaa could get a lot of work this preseason and might even crack the rotation early in the regular season for the Lions.
The Terry McLaurin trade request has taken some of the sheen off an otherwise-buzzy offseason for the Commanders.
Tampa Bay's offense has a chance to be among the best, assuming the Tristan Wirfs injury doesn't linger too long.
Rookie WR Emeka Egbuka apparently looks good early, contributing to the strong big-picture operation of the Buccaneers' offense.
Rachaad White is reportedly slimmed down, which is a positive sign for the Buccaneers' offensive big-picture operation.
Chris Godwin might be a tough call for Week 1 due to injury concerns, though the Buccaneers' big-picture offense still looks strong.
Jayden Daniels gave the Buccaneers trouble in a playoff loss, highlighting a past defensive struggle for Tampa Bay.
Left tackle seems to be up in the air for the Packers, with Jordan Morgan attempting to unseat Rasheed Walker.
Rasheed Walker is being challenged by Jordan Morgan for the starting left tackle spot, as the position is currently up in the air for the Packers.
First-rounder Matthew Golden is making a strong first impression, contributing to the early good returns on the Packers' wide receiver room.
Jordan Love is entering a critical season where he needs the offensive operation around him to be as clean as possible, especially after dropped passes were an issue last year.
Matthew Stafford is currently dealing with back pain, and keeping him healthy is a major component of the Rams avoiding another slow start.
The analyst questions why the Rams would bring in Davante Adams for significant money if keeping Matthew Stafford healthy isn't prioritized for a strong start.
The biggest coefficient for the Vikings' season is the play of J.J. McCarthy; not everyone is convinced he'll elevate the team, but the analyst is optimistic about his potential.
Bo Nix deftly answered a lot of challenges last season, which is a positive sign for the Broncos who are on the verge of breaking through.
Trey Hendrickson is not practicing due to negotiations, and a quick resolution is needed to prevent his status from negatively impacting the Bengals' season.
Ja’Marr Chase previously didn't practice much before Week 1 and then didn't play well in early games, serving as a cautionary tale for Trey Hendrickson's current holdout.
Trey Lance performed well in the Hall of Fame Game, making a stronger push for the backup quarterback job for the Chargers.
The Chargers will realistically go as far as Justin Herbert can carry them, with hope for help from rookies and a reshuffled offensive line.
The Chargers had to deal for Taylor Heinicke last August, indicating previous concerns about quarterback depth.
Rookie Omarion Hampton is expected to provide a decent amount of help to Justin Herbert and the Chargers' offense.
Rookie Tre Harris is expected to provide a decent amount of help to Justin Herbert and the Chargers' offense.
Rookie KeAndre Lambert-Smith is expected to provide a decent amount of help to Justin Herbert and the Chargers' offense.
The Texans clearly have the best quarterback in a weaker division with C.J. Stroud, who has strong chances to move forward after a sideways sophomore campaign.
Joe Mixon’s availability is murky, which is a concern for the Texans' offensive line and overall offensive outlook.
There is uncertainty about Houston's weapons after Nico Collins, implying he is a key receiving option.
Nick Bosa is back and looks better overall, contributing to the expectation of substantial improvement from the 49ers' defense.
Offensively, the Niners need more availability from Christian McCaffrey if Brock Purdy and he are to keep the team in contending ranks.
Ricky Pearsall is an important player for the 49ers this season, playing a key role in the receiver room that needs to sort itself out.
If Brock Purdy and Christian McCaffrey stay relatively healthy this season, the analyst would be surprised if San Francisco is not back among the contending ranks.
The Steelers' offense is working through things as it gets Aaron Rodgers up to speed, and anxiety remains over how prolific this unit will be.
There has been some early panic over the play of Caleb Williams following a Family Fest practice, though he finished strong with a touchdown pass.
Kyler Murray played pretty well last season, and a breakout year from Marvin Harrison Jr. could level this offense up a notch.
A breakout year from Marvin Harrison Jr. could level the Cardinals' offense up a notch, alongside Kyler Murray.
Even with rookie Walter Nolen sidelined, the Cardinals' front looks far more capable of collapsing pockets this season.
The Cardinals' defensive improvements might depend on how much 2024 first-rounder Darius Robinson and other rookies can contribute.
The Cardinals' defensive improvements might depend on how much rookies like Will Johnson and others can contribute.
The Cardinals' defensive improvements might depend on how much rookies like Jordan Burch and others can contribute.
Sam Darnold is, of course, the biggest X-factor for the Seahawks' offense, which has many new parts.
Cooper Kupp is mentioned as the Seahawks' top new receiver in an offense with so many new parts.
Zach Charbonnet appears to be making a strong case to share carries with Kenneth Walker III for the Seahawks.
Zach Charbonnet appears to be making a strong case to share carries with Kenneth Walker III for the Seahawks, indicating a robust run game.
Rookie playmaker Elijah Arroyo has turned heads early in camp for the Seahawks' offense.
Rookie playmaker Tory Horton has turned heads early in camp for the Seahawks' offense.
Second-rounder Donovan Ezeiruaku continues impressing, although the Cowboys still can't count on a consistent pass rush without Micah Parsons.
There's a question of how much preseason time Dak Prescott will receive coming off hamstring surgery, as the Cowboys cannot risk their QB getting hurt.
Dak Prescott needs time to mesh with new WR George Pickens as the Cowboys prepare for the season.
Darnell Mooney is a question mark for Week 1, which may cause the Falcons' offense to lean on the run game until Michael Penix Jr. gets his feet underneath him.
QB Michael Penix Jr. has had some ups and downs in camp, with his accuracy being something to monitor after hitting on 58 percent of his passes in three rookie starts.
James Pearce Jr., a controversial pick, has been an early camp star and looked like an instant contributor as a pass rusher for the Falcons.
Jalon Walker has been sidelined with a hamstring injury, impacting the Falcons' pass rush depth.
The Patriots are seemingly focused on the quick passing game and getting the ball out of Drake Maye’s hands quickly with two expected rookie OL starters.
Will Campbell is one of two expected rookie OL starters manning the left side of the line for the Patriots, which may necessitate a quick passing game.
Jared Wilson is one of two expected rookie OL starters manning the left side of the line for the Patriots, which may necessitate a quick passing game.
There is something brewing on the Patriots' defense if they can get Christian Gonzalez and Carlton Davis back on the field.
There is something brewing on the Patriots' defense if they can get Carlton Davis and Christian Gonzalez back on the field.
Travis Hunter is expected to play a 60-40 mix on offense and defense for the Jaguars and is already must-see TV.
Brian Thomas Jr. should be a fun dance partner alongside Travis Hunter in the Jaguars' offense, but he and Trevor Lawrence still need to fine-tune their connection.
There's still time for Trevor Lawrence to turn things around for the Jaguars, and he has horses and a scheme to help.
Brian Thomas Jr. did much of his damage last season with Mac Jones at quarterback, implying a past connection.
It's easier picturing Geno Smith as part of the Raiders' initial spark this season, contributing to optimism.
It's easier picturing Brock Bowers as part of the Raiders' initial spark this season, contributing to optimism.
It's easier picturing Jakobi Meyers as part of the Raiders' initial spark this season, contributing to optimism.
It's easier picturing Ashton Jeanty as part of the Raiders' initial spark this season, contributing to optimism.
After Christian Wilkins’ release, there’s less talent up front defensively for the Raiders, posing a major objective to improve.
Tua Tagovailoa has been sharp early in practice, which is a welcome sign for the Dolphins, and he also earned praise for calling out Tyreek Hill.
Tua Tagovailoa earned rightful praise for calling out Tyreek Hill and demanding more accountability, raising questions about whether the star receiver is on board.
Jaylen Waddle has been an early camp standout, contributing to the hope that the Dolphins' offense can still thrive.
The analyst is getting a strong feeling about Cam Ward, expecting his presence and exciting arm talent to eventually lift all boats for the Titans.
Calvin Ridley seems energized again and, with Cam Ward, could help compensate for some weaker spots on the Titans' roster.
Anthony Richardson is in a real quarterback battle, with encouraging practices followed by tougher ones, though he's recently stacked stronger performances.
Daniel Jones is in a real quarterback battle for the Colts, with his performance yo-yoing between encouraging and tougher practices.
Rookie Tyler Warren appears to be a precocious rookie who can immediately help whichever quarterback wins the job for the Colts.
WR Adonai Mitchell might be poised for a breakout season, adding potential to the Colts' offense.
First-rounder Tetaroia McMillan has flashed some skill amid inconsistencies, contributing to more juice in the Panthers' receiver room.
Fellow rookie Jimmy Horn Jr. has opened eyes as a playmaker for the Panthers, adding to the juice in their receiver room.
Xavier Legette looks poised for more in Year 2 for the Panthers, contributing to the improved receiver room.
Jalen Coker can build on an impressive rookie season for the Panthers, adding to the depth in the receiver room.
Adam Thielen remains with the Panthers, contributing to the overall depth and "juice" in the receiver room.
David Moore remains with the Panthers, contributing to the overall depth and "juice" in the receiver room.
Hunter Renfrow is doing his best to revive his career with the Panthers, adding to the improved receiver room.
The improved receiver room is a positive for Bryce Young’s development, despite concerns about the Panthers' defense.
Breece Hall is one of three quality backs who give the Jets the personnel to successfully implement a new run-game focused approach.
Braelon Allen is one of three quality backs who give the Jets the personnel to successfully implement a new run-game focused approach.
Isaiah Davis is one of three quality backs who give the Jets the personnel to successfully implement a new run-game focused approach.
Justin Fields, a running quarterback, is part of the Jets' personnel well-suited to implement a new run-game focused approach.
Malik Nabers was banged up with a shoulder injury early in camp, causing concern, though he appears fine and was tearing up camp beforehand.
The analyst suggests to "wait until you see Abdul Carter play real games," implying exceptional potential for the Giants rookie.
The Giants' strong first-year class could become great if rookie QB Jaxson Dart performs well in Year 1.
Tyrann Mathieu’s pre-camp retirement was a shock and a blow to the Saints, adding to their current challenges.
Cameron Jordan is mentioned as a "fading star" for the Saints, contributing to a dim outlook for the team.
Taysom Hill is mentioned as a "fading star" and is currently on the PUP list for the Saints, contributing to a dim outlook.
Second-round pick Quinshon Judkins was arrested and hasn't participated in team activities since, contributing to a tough camp for the Browns.
Kenny Pickett got hurt, throwing a wrench into the Browns' four-QB jamboree and contributing to a difficult camp.
CB Martin Emerson suffered a season-ending Achilles injury, making it a difficult camp for the Browns and adding to defensive concerns.
Dillon Gabriel has not yet been able to make a big move in the Browns' quarterback battle, making the outcome uncertain.
Shedeur Sanders has not yet been able to make a big move in the Browns' quarterback battle, making the outcome uncertain.
There are questions about the number of weapons available to the Browns' quarterbacks after Jerry Jeudy, implying he is a primary option.
There are questions about the number of weapons available to the Browns' quarterbacks after David Njoku, implying he is a primary option.
Arizona could be on the cusp of playoff contention if Kyler Murray finds more week-to-week consistency.
Despite losing standout center Drew Dalman in free agency, Atlanta still features one of the NFL’s top offensive lines.
Limited by cap space, their only notable free-agent addition was Leonard Floyd, who posted just a 54.5 pass-rush grade in 2024.
For Atlanta to contend for an NFC South title, Michael Penix Jr. must deliver over a full season.
Derrick Henry and Lamar Jackson formed a historically great rushing duo in 2024, powering the Ravens to a 94.5 team PFF rushing grade.
Derrick Henry and Lamar Jackson formed a historically great rushing duo in 2024, powering the Ravens to a 94.5 team PFF rushing grade.
Buffalo’s MVP-winning quarterback remains the foundation of the team’s success and continued to carry the Bills into Super Bowl contention.
Carolina spent significant resources improving its offensive line last offseason, particularly on the interior with the additions of guards Damien Lewis and Robert Hunt.
Carolina spent significant resources improving its offensive line last offseason, particularly on the interior with the additions of guards Damien Lewis and Robert Hunt.
Carolina's improved offensive line gave Bryce Young a chance to succeed from the pocket, and his development is a key factor for the team's success.
The defensive line should take a step forward with the additions of rookies Princely Umanmielen, Nic Scourton and Cam'Ron Jackson.
The defensive line should take a step forward with the additions of rookies Princely Umanmielen, Nic Scourton and Cam'Ron Jackson.
The defensive line should take a step forward with the additions of rookies Princely Umanmielen, Nic Scourton and Cam'Ron Jackson.
The defensive line should take a step forward with the return of Derrick Brown.
Chicago already had a solid tackle duo in Darnell Wright, who ranked 16th among qualified tackles in PFF grade last season.
Chicago already had a solid tackle duo in Braxton Jones, who ranked 22nd among qualified tackles in PFF grade last season.
The team overhauled its interior offensive line this offseason by acquiring Joe Thuney, Drew Dalman and Jonah Jackson.
The team overhauled its interior offensive line this offseason by acquiring Joe Thuney, Drew Dalman and Jonah Jackson.
The team overhauled its interior offensive line this offseason by acquiring Joe Thuney, Drew Dalman and Jonah Jackson.
Few quarterbacks face more pressure this season than Caleb Williams, and if his production matches his elite talent, Chicago could contend for a playoff spot.
When Joe Burrow, Ja'Marr Chase and Tee Higgins are all on the field, the Bengals can compete with anyone.
When Joe Burrow, Ja'Marr Chase and Tee Higgins are all on the field, the Bengals can compete with anyone.
When Joe Burrow, Ja'Marr Chase and Tee Higgins are all on the field, the Bengals can compete with anyone.
One constant for the Browns is a dominant defensive line led by Myles Garrett, which should keep the team competitive.
This season’s quarterback group includes 40-year-old Joe Flacco and rookies Dillon Gabriel and Shedeur Sanders.
This season’s quarterback group includes 40-year-old Joe Flacco and rookies Dillon Gabriel and Shedeur Sanders.
This season’s quarterback group includes 40-year-old Joe Flacco and rookies Dillon Gabriel and Shedeur Sanders.
Although elite edge defender Micah Parsons is gone, the Cowboys were at their most dangerous when forcing opponents into obvious passing situations.
Osa Odighizuwa contributed 60 interior pressures, and the team bolstered its pass-rushing depth this offseason with additions such as Dante Fowler Jr. and Donovan Ezeiruaku.
The team bolstered its pass-rushing depth this offseason with additions such as Dante Fowler Jr. and second-round rookie Donovan Ezeiruaku.
The team bolstered its pass-rushing depth this offseason with additions such as second-round rookie Donovan Ezeiruaku, who could also contribute to shoring up run defense.
Dak Prescott will need to prove last year’s struggles were an outlier for the Cowboys to reach the postseason.
Micah Parsons, now with the Packers, led all Dallas defensive linemen in run-defense grade at only 65.5.
The Broncos need a pass-catching option beyond Courtland Sutton after ranking 28th in PFF receiving grade last season.
One potential boost could come from new tight end Evan Engram, as Denver’s tight ends posted a league-worst 48.0 PFF receiving grade last year.
Aidan Hutchinson’s season-ending injury derailed the Lions’ pass rush last season, though he was pacing the league with a 95.0 PFF pass-rush grade prior.
The Packers’ cornerback unit appears shaky heading into the 2025 season, particularly after the loss of veterans Jaire Alexander and Eric Stokes.
The Packers’ cornerback unit appears shaky heading into the 2025 season, particularly after the loss of veterans Jaire Alexander and Eric Stokes.
Carrington Valentine played reasonably well down the stretch last season for the Packers' cornerback unit.
Will Anderson Jr. and Danielle Hunter led the way on the defensive line, each ranking among the top 20 edge rushers in PFF pass-rush grade and pressures.
Will Anderson Jr. and Danielle Hunter led the way on the defensive line, each ranking among the top 20 edge rushers in PFF pass-rush grade and pressures.
The Texans' secondary features an outstanding cornerback duo in Derek Stingley Jr. and Kamari Lassiter, each of whom placed among the top 12 cornerbacks in PFF coverage grade in 2024.
The Texans' secondary features an outstanding cornerback duo in Derek Stingley Jr. and Kamari Lassiter, each of whom placed among the top 12 cornerbacks in PFF coverage grade in 2024.
Houston’s offensive line became its Achilles' heel as C.J. Stroud took the second-most sacks in the NFL.
The front office has since traded star left tackle Laremy Tunsil to Washington, leaving the unit without a single player who graded above 70.2 last season.
Slot receiver Josh Downs finished 2024 with an 85.1 PFF receiving grade, 11th best in the NFL.
Michael Pittman Jr. has earned at least a 70.0 PFF receiving grade in four straight seasons.
Alec Pierce ranked 11th in the NFL with a 99.1 deep PFF receiving grade last year.
Adonai Mitchell and rookie tight end Tyler Warren also figure to be factors in the Colts' passing game.
Adonai Mitchell and rookie tight end Tyler Warren also figure to be factors in the Colts' passing game.
Anthony Richardson lost the quarterback competition and has posted a 58.7 PFF passing grade across his two NFL seasons.
Daniel Jones came out on top in the quarterback competition, but isn’t as athletic and owns the lowest big-time throw rate of any quarterback with at least 700 dropbacks since 2021.
2024 rookie sensation Brian Thomas Jr. stunned the league by turning in an 83.4 PFF receiving grade, a top-20 mark, last season.
2025 first-round pick Travis Hunter's 89.0 PFF receiving grade placed seventh in the FBS last season despite his playing nearly 800 snaps at cornerback, and he may need to help in the secondary.
A healthy Trevor Lawrence and the addition of Travis Hunter give Jacksonville hopes for a bounce-back.
Creed Humphrey and Trey Smith are two excellent interior players for the Chiefs, though the team needs to improve at tackle spots and left guard.
Creed Humphrey and Trey Smith are two excellent interior players for the Chiefs, though the team needs to improve at tackle spots and left guard.
The Chiefs’ core is still intact with Patrick Mahomes, and it’s hard not to see them as prime AFC contenders, considering their success in the Mahomes era.
The Raiders acquired quarterback Geno Smith to address their low passing grade, and his addition should immediately improve the offense.
The Raiders drafted running back Ashton Jeanty to address their low rushing grade, and his addition should immediately improve the offense.
Wide receiver Ladd McConkey was outstanding in his rookie season, but the Chargers are searching for pass-catching depth behind him.
Joshua Palmer departed in free agency, contributing to the Chargers' search for pass-catching depth.
Quentin Johnston earned a 68.2 PFF receiving grade last season, contributing to concerns about the Chargers' pass-catching depth.
Keenan Allen earned a 68.2 PFF receiving grade last season, contributing to concerns about the Chargers' pass-catching depth.
Rashawn Slater’s season-ending injury is very concerning for the Chargers' prospects.
Puka Nacua led the NFL in PFF receiving grade despite missing six games for the Rams' highest-graded wide receiver unit.
Los Angeles let Cooper Kupp depart, but picked up Davante Adams to bolster their receiving corps.
Los Angeles picked up Davante Adams, who earned a 76.8 PFF receiving grade last season, to enhance their receiving unit.
Tutu Atwell and Jordan Whittington are viable options in the Rams' deep wide receiver and tight end rooms.
Tutu Atwell and Jordan Whittington are viable options in the Rams' deep wide receiver and tight end rooms.
The Rams have a deep tight end room that features Tyler Higbee, Colby Parkinson and second-round rookie Terrance Ferguson.
The Rams have a deep tight end room that features Tyler Higbee, Colby Parkinson and second-round rookie Terrance Ferguson.
The Rams have a deep tight end room that features Tyler Higbee, Colby Parkinson and second-round rookie Terrance Ferguson.
The health of Matthew Stafford could be a key to the Rams’ season, as they need their starting quarterback on the field.
The health of Alaric Jackson could be a key to the Rams’ season, ensuring the offensive line can keep the quarterback healthy.
De'Von Achane has recorded a 92.2 PFF rushing grade over the past two years, placing him second best in the NFL.
Behind Achane is Jaylen Wright, who posted a solid 75.8 PFF rushing grade as a rookie.
On the perimeter, Tyreek Hill and Jaylen Waddle combine to form one of the most explosive receiver pairings in the NFL.
On the perimeter, Tyreek Hill and Jaylen Waddle combine to form one of the most explosive receiver pairings in the NFL.
Jalen Ramsey, one of the two players who kept the Dolphins' cornerback unit afloat, was traded to Pittsburgh.
Kader Kohou, one of the two players who kept the Dolphins' cornerback unit afloat, suffered a season-ending knee injury.
If Tua Tagovailoa can play all 17 games, which he’s done just once, then the Dolphins have enough offensive firepower to compete for a playoff spot.
J.J. McCarthy is entering his first season as Minnesota’s starting quarterback and is the biggest question mark for the Vikings, with only a handful of preseason snaps on his NFL resume.
Including the postseason, Aaron Jones racked up more than 1,600 yards from scrimmage last season as part of J.J. McCarthy's outstanding supporting cast.
Led by Justin Jefferson, the Vikings ranked fourth in the NFL in PFF receiving grade, providing an outstanding supporting cast for their new quarterback.
The Vikings could boast one of the NFL’s best offensive line units if Christian Darrisaw and Will Fries stay healthy.
The Vikings could boast one of the NFL’s best offensive line units if Christian Darrisaw and Will Fries stay healthy.
Former Eagle Milton Williams, who led the NFL in PFF pass-rush grade in 2024, and a healthy Christian Barmore could form a dominant interior duo for the Patriots' defense.
A healthy Christian Barmore and Milton Williams could form a dominant interior duo for the Patriots' defense.
Any postseason hopes for the Patriots rest with the development of Drake Maye and a very young offense that will take time to jell.
